function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Global pandemic as a result of neglecting public health","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Separation of health from other sustainability goals","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Spread of respiratory pandemics like covid-19 in urban settings","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Neglect of communicable diseases in ’healthy urban planning’ literature and policy","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Covid-19 transmission within and between cities and city regions","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Social and economic consequences of implementing public health measures","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of literature reviews on the connection between npis and urban planning and design in the context of pandemics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Less stringent approach to reviewing the literature, such as rapid reviews, leading to scope for heterogeneity in the employment of rapid reviews","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Examination of multi-disciplinary literature on how planning and designing cities intersects with pandemics of infectious respiratory diseases.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limiting search terms based on authors’ personal interests may lead to overlooking important aspects of the intersection between pandemics and urban planning.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Rapid review process may result in overlooking key studies and relevant literature, leading to biased conclusions and recommendations.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of formal quality appraisal tool used in the review","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Considerable overlap between themes and papers crossing themes","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inclusion and exclusion criteria for research may not cover all relevant urban contexts related to pandemics of respiratory diseases, leading to a limited scope of the study.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Articles focused on covid-19, spanish influenza, h1n1, and generic ’influenza’ or ’pandemic influenza’ increase the risk of propagating contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inclusion of multiple international contexts, including developed and lmic contexts, increases the risk of global disease spread.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of explicit inclusion of equity considerations in the literature review may perpetuate health disparities and lead to unequal access to healthcare resources.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global spread of infectious diseases through travel","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate urban planning for infectious disease containment","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate ventilation in office and residential buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective health and safety management in residential apartment buildings","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate urban design for open public spaces","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient governance and stakeholder engagement in pandemic-focused urban planning","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of effective pandemic responses at the local government level","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of institutional coordination across multiple agencies and different jurisdictions","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ethical issues related to communicating risks and responses","category":"Legal risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Allocation of scarce resources in socioeconomically different urban areas","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Airports identified as efficient but expensive for controlling infection spread","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effectiveness of npis dependent on urban planning and design","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of infectious diseases in urban settings due to population density","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of clear relationship between population density and infectious disease transmission","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Connectivity between districts impacting mortality during influenza pandemic","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effect of density and npis on infection rates","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Spatial disparities in transport infrastructure correlated with h1n1 outbreak impacts","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High density residential areas linked to covid-19 outbreak","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 due to air pollution-to-human transmission","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of urban system preparedness for respiratory pandemics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate collaboration across sectors and disciplines","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor integration of pandemic guidance into urban planning","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Intercity and intra city transport systems, airports, ports, and hubs pose essential threats to urban areas and make them vulnerable to pandemics.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close similarities observed between historical guidance and 2007 guidance in pandemic preparedness planning.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Significant and positive association between the frequency of flights, trains, and buses from specific regions and the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of infrastructure preparedness for respiratory pandemics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Maximizing mobility at street level through urban informatics and data","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective enforcement of mandatory face mask use, leading to reduced compliance and increased risk of disease transmission in public transportation settings.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate infrastructure and facilities for managing contagious disease outbreaks in public venues, leading to compromised patient care and increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerable populations at risk due to respiratory pandemics","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of urban design responses and mitigation strategies for respiratory pandemics","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate engagement of diverse communities in pandemic planning","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate coverage of equity issues in the literature review","category":"Social risks","confidence":"High"}]}
